thread.title: Hurricane Joaquin Air Travel and Cruise Updates
thread.title_full: Hurricane Joaquin Air Travel and Cruise Updates - The New York Times

author: Shivani Vora
title: Hurricane Joaquin Air Travel and Cruise Updates
text:
Hurricane Joaquin, the category 4 storm that struck the Bahamas , is affecting air travel and cruise lines in the area.
Though Lynden Pindling International Airport in Nassau is officially open according to a statement on its website, American Airlines has canceled six out of seven departures from there. The airline has also canceled its one scheduled departure from Exuma International Airport and one out of two departures from Providenciales International Airport in the Turks and Caicos, a destination also hit by Joaquin. Though the airport suspended flight operations yesterday, the website says that it plans to resume them today starting at 11 a.m.
Cruise lines have not canceled any trips, though some have rerouted their itineraries to avoid ports in the Bahamas.
Norwegian Cruise Line is altering the itinerary of its Norwegian Getaway ship; instead of stopping on the island of Nassau today, it will remain at sea and return to Miami as planned on Saturday morning.
